ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I definitely learned a bit of Hebrew.
I learned a lot of Hebrew.
I really felt that my knowledge in Hebrew grew in this class. I liked that it was tailored to build on the knowledge of the future tense, while having a main focus on the passive binyanim.
My Hebrew speaking, writing, grammar, vocabulary all improved.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I liked how interactive the course was and how hands on the professor and students were.
Could spend kess time going over administrative details.
I think this class is great. The only suggestions I would make is for Hebrew tables to be by level, not all the levels together.
great teacher and TF, nice incorporation of TV shows

Its great that its a small class, which allows for an intimate learning environment. Shiri is a great instructor and the Hebrew Department is all very supportive. Nothing major concerning weaknesses - I just personally did not like the classroom (which is a silly thing to complain about. I find it difficult to focus with a lot of moving around in the classroom.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely take Hebrew classes at Yale! The department is great, as are the Professors!
Definitely. I came into the hebrew department expecting to stop after three semesters and now want to continue onto five or six.
Yes, absolutely. I went to Jewish day school growing up, and I've learned more in this department in one year than I did in 10 years in day school. The faculty is amazing, and the program is great.
If you want to grasp hebrew yes
If you're interested in learning Hebrew, then go for it. Its great.
